ai-tha-ap269:1.1_0: “One from the bank of the river,
ai-tha-ap269:1.3_0: I saw the Buddha with my own hands,
ai-tha-ap269:2.1_0: raising his hands in respectful salutation,
ai-tha-ap269:2.2_0: while looking around the great Sage,
ai-tha-ap269:2.4_0: Because I was not worshipped by the King.
ai-tha-ap269:3.1_0: if he makes his four eons;
ai-tha-ap269:3.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap269:5.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Jotipāla.
ai-tha-ap269:6.1_0: Jina, the Elders of the Jina, (and) seventh,
